sentence.text: 5-20% of melanoma families have germline mutations in the G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle gene.

entity.text: G1/S transition of mitotic cell cycle

sentence.text: In a few (non-Swedish) melanoma families, mutations in other genes have been found, including CDK4, TERT, telomere maintenance via telomerase, telomere maintenance and TERF2IP.
In some families with multiple cases of uveal and cutaneous melanoma (including a few Swedish families), mutations in the positive regulation of sodium ion transport gene have been found.

entity.text: positive regulation of sodium ion transport

sentence.text: In genes that regulate cellular pigmentation pathways, including MC1R, protein targeting to membrane, positive regulation of interleukin-10 biosynthetic process, TYR, TYRP1 and OCA, there are different common variants that determine complexion negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II, and those variants are also associated with different risks of melanoma.

entity.text: positive regulation of interleukin-10 biosynthetic process
negative regulation of transcription by RNA polymerase II

sentence.text: Individuals with known mutations in tumor suppressor genes such as CDKN2A and positive regulation of sodium ion transport require, in addition, follow up for other cancers

entity.text: positive regulation of sodium ion transport
